data.description:
First Hand is an official Hand Tracking demo built by Meta. Experience the magic of interacting with the virtual world directly with your hands. Use switches, levers, virtual UIs as you solve puzzles to build robotic gloves, and then experience their superpowers. 

We built First Hand to demonstrate the capabilities and the variety of interaction models possible with Hands. This demo is built using the Presence Platformâ€™s Interaction SDK, a library of interaction components, gestures and tools to build magical hand and controller interactions. This demo is also available as an open source project for developers who would like to easily replicate similar interactions.

We drew inspiration in this demo from First Contact, the original Meta experience showcasing controller interactions.

changelog.change_log:
* Removed need to set up scene for Mixed Reality sections as it forced users to switch to controllers
* Providing a popup message to switch to controller play during street scene if users are not able to successfully use the teleport hand gesture
* Fixes for microphone access issues related to voice commands if user has microphone disabled
* Improved voice command handling for better accuracy
* Bug fixes and graphical improvements

* Polygon reductions on some models for reducing overdraw
* Sprite mipmapping
* Controllers-as-hands fixes
A new adventure awaits!  Chapter 2 of First Hand introduces you to locomotion: using only your hands to move around the world and complete an all-new mission!
